scenario: Shares of American Express (AXP) stock rose 58.4% in 2024, with a market cap of over $200 billion, making it one of the largest financial institutions in the world. The company posted strong earnings growth, with earnings per share (EPS) increasing to $13.59 from $11.21 in 2023. Total spending across its credit card network grew 6% year over year, while net card fees and net interest income grew in the double digits. Net write-offs on its loans declined and are below pre-pandemic levels. The stock's price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio expanded from 17 to 22.28, contributing to the stock's gain. American Express added over 3 million new credit cards to its network in the first three quarters of 2024, primarily from millennial and Gen Z spenders, providing a long runway for future growth. The company's high-quality business and strong brand, as held by Warren Buffett, make it a promising investment for the long haul.
